alert.note: Alert for Crittenden; Cross; Lee; St. Francis (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 19 at 3:30AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of East Arkansas, North Mississippi and West Tennessee, including the following counties, in East Arkansas, Crittenden, Cross, Lee and St. Francis. In North Mississippi, DeSoto. In West Tennessee, Shelby. * WHEN...Until 545 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 330 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Forrest City, Wynne, Hughes, Parkin, Madison, Village Creek State Park, Memphis, Walls, Caldwell, Edmondson, Colt, Horseshoe Lake, Widener, Hickory Ridge, Anthonyville, Jennette, New Home, Simsboro, Vanndale and Pinckney. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
